Omg! Didn't know that such part existed. It really needs an update.

Here's a patch that makes it attachable to the ground with KIS. (It also fixes the stack node.) Bear in mind that the default connection to the ground is not very strong, so don't use them as road barriers or anything like that!


@PART[Deployable_Light-01]
{

    @node_stack_bottom = 0.0, -0.16, 0.0, 0.0, -1.0, 0.0, 0


    -MODULE[KASModuleGrab]{}

    MODULE
    {
        name = ModuleKISItem
        allowAttachOnStatic = true
    }

    MODULE
    {
        name = ModuleKISPartStatic
    }
}

Here's a patch....

so download the file and then where to I add this patch?

so download the file and then where to I add this patch?

You need to have Deployable Light Globe and Module Manager. Then, copy that patch into a text file (by convention, they're all named something.cfg) in your GameData folder.

..Then, copy that patch into a text file (by convention, they're all named something.cfg) in your GameData folder.

and place that .cfg in the same folder as this mod or directly into the GameData folder?

sorry for the silly questions, I never added a patch before

and place that .cfg in the same folder as this mod or directly into the GameData folder?

sorry for the silly questions, I never added a patch before

You can put patches anywhere in the gamedata folder.

and place that .cfg in the same folder as this mod or directly into the GameData folder?

sorry for the silly questions, I never added a patch before

As MeCripp says, you can put patches anywhere, but I put mine in a "ZZZ_Unofficial_Patches" folder -- that way, I never forget where they are in case I feel like changing them, and they don't get accidentally deleted when I update things.
